org.hypergraphdb.viewer
Class GraphView

java.lang.Object
  org.hypergraphdb.viewer.GraphView

public class GraphView
extends java.lang.Object

GraphView is the main Piccolo component which displays the graph on the screen using PNodeView and PEdgeView instances to visually represent nodes and edges. For its internal model GraphView uses FNode and FEdge classes. FNode simply encapsulate a HGHandle form the viewed HG and FEdge represents a relation between two FNodes e.g. a HGLink(source node) and one of its target set members(target node). Based on this model GraphView creates and displays above mentioned PNodeViews and PEdgeViews. GraphView has some pre-built features as: zooming, few selection modes, hand-drawing mode (squiggle), visual styling support and customizable node/edge painting.

Zooming

  • Right Mouse Button Down + Drag Left OR Alt + Up = Zoom In
  • Right Mouse Button Down + Drag Right OR Alt + Down = Zoom Out

    • Selection modes

    GraphView has 3 selection modes:
  • Node selection - only nodes are selectable either by left click or mouse drag
  • Edge selection - only edges are selectable
  • Nodes & Edges selection - nodes and edges are selectable

    • Squiggle

    You can draw by hand over the graph to add some comments or emphasize on some node, edge etc. To switch to this mode you could use menu command, call HGVKit.setSquiggleState(true) - which works for all opened viewers or use the GraphView's own squiggleHandler.

    Visual Appearance

    GraphView displays PNodeView and PEdgeView by using instances of DefaultNodePainter and DefaultEdgePainter. You can define your own painters according to the type of the node's handle - graph.getTypeSystem().getTypeHandle(graph.get(node.getHandle()).getClass()). Note that edge painters are defined according the edge's source node. Those painters are stored in a VisualStyle and styles are stored in a VisualManager. By default GraphView uses a style named "default", but you could simply define your own styles and switch between them.

    applyAppearances

    public void applyAppearances()
    Recalculates and reapplies all the node and edge appearances.

    applyNodeAppearances

    public void applyNodeAppearances()
    Recalculates and reapplies all of the node appearances. The visual attributes are calculated by delegating to the NodePainter member of the current visual style.

    applyEdgeAppearances

    public void applyEdgeAppearances()
    Recalculates and reapplies all of the edge appearances. The visual attributes are calculated by delegating to the EdgePainter member of the current visual style.
